task_name: find cognitive exercises for dementia prevention
task_description: Task to find cognitive exercises for dementia prevention

nice_to_have: Memory games that involve matching pairs
Reading and discussing books with friends
deal_breakers: Options that are not adaptable for different stages of dementia
Programs that do not consider individual cognitive levels or preferences

decision_factors: Effectiveness of exercises in cognitive enhancement
Personalization of exercises based on individual needs
Time commitment required for each exercise

technical: Something with good graphics but I don't know what that means
I think it needs to be interactive, but not sure how that works
Maybe some kind of app or website, I'm not really familiar with those terms
non_technical: I want it to be modern looking, whatever that means
It should be engaging, but I'm not clear on how to measure that
I heard community support is important but I'm not sure why

must_meet: It should look appealing to users, whatever that entails
I think the exercises need to be backed by some sort of research, but I'm not sure how to find that
should_meet: The exercises need to be easy to understand, but I'm not sure what constitutes easy
I believe they should involve some level of challenge, but I can't define that
nice_to_meet: If they could utilize technology in a fun way, that would be great, but I'm unclear on what that means
It would be nice if there were options for different stages of dementia, although I'm confused about those stages

metadata.task: find cognitive exercises for dementia prevention
